metadata.dc:title: Young patient with pulmonary nodules
metadata.dc:description: The case of a 33 year-old patient is described; she was admitted to hospital due to pleuritic chest pain, cough, dyspnoea and constitutional syndrome. Infiltrated bilateral lung nodules were observed in the chest x-ray. After performing a lung biopsy, the diagnosis was lung micosis due to Cryptococcus neoformans. Lung cryptococcus is an uncommon entity that can affect both immunodeficient and immunocompetent individuals, although less frequent in these latter.
